situation.title: Notaries, lawyers, executors
situation.meta_description: The general ban on service providers does not apply to lawyers, notaries, or executors.

content.processed:
Rules and Recommendations

The general ban on service providers does not apply to lawyers, notaries, or executors. You can continue to use their services, upon agreement with their office.

Lawyers, notaries, and executors can issue their specific measures, so contact them directly for more detailed information.

 

If you have an acute legal problem, you can contact the free telephone consultation on this website.

links.title: Information for members of the Bar Association can be found on the ČAK website
Information for members of the Notarial Chamber can be found on the NKČR website
Information for members of the Bailiffs' Chamber can be found on the EKČR  website

questions_answers.question: Can I book a lawyers' appointment?
questions_answers.value: Can I book a lawyers' appointment? Yes, the current ban on the service providers does not apply to lawyers, notaries, or executors.

questions_answers.question: Can a lawyer visit a prison where I am serving a prison sentence?
Is it possible to write a will at the time of a state of an emergency with a notary?
questions_answers.value: Yes, you can book a notary appointment, as they continue to provide their services.

questions_answers.question: Does the CZECH Point service work during the state of an emergency?
questions_answers.value: Yes. You can also visit the Czech Post branches, that offer CZECH Point services.

questions_answers.question: What if I have a notary's appointment for estate proceedings and have a coronavirus?
questions_answers.value: You must be at home during the insulation period. Therefore, call the notary, tell them the information and arrange a new date.
